newsitem.title: USA: Merrill Lynch chairman pay tops $10 mln - NYT.
newsitem.headline: Merrill Lynch chairman pay tops $10 mln - NYT.

text.p: Daniel Tully, the chairman of Merrill Lynch & Co, earned more than $10 million last year, the New York Times reported on Tuesday.
The report said the amount was equivalent to a raise of about 40 percent and consisted of salary, restricted stock and a $6.5 million bonus, up from Tully's 1995 bonus of $4.64 million.

President and Chief Executive David Komansky received a total of $8.13 million in 1996, the report said. It said top pay also went to executive vice presidents Herbert Allison Jr, Jerome Kenny and John Steffens, each of whom made between $4 million and $7 million.
